reviewText: The music is great and both my children enjoy watching Bob the Builder.  The stories are a little out there especially with talking machinery but for kids I'm sure it's entertaining.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Aidan has not seen too Bob the Builder and this DVD really was a great introduction to some Bob favorites. He really enjoyed watching Bob and his friends build and work together and he get's really excited when he hears "Can we build it?" I thought the DVD was adorable and I especially love that it is 140 minutes of Bob-filled fun! I don't even think we have made it through the whole DVD yet as Aidan always want to start from the beginning! This DVD is also an exceptional value of about $15! I think it would be great for both new and old Bob lovers!
summary: Great for new or old Bob fans!

reviewText: I'm way too old for this, but it seemed like a good background filler at the time.  Stories are short and direct, with good morals.  Probably great for the target audience, but I did get a bit bored after a while.  I do love stop-action animation, though, and this filled that bill.
summary: I guess I should be fair

reviewText: I love the older Bob episodes before the newer animation.  My son (2yr) could go either way. But since I'm watching with him, I normally prefer these. Nice collection of stories.  Easily divided up into shorter viewings (10-15 minutes) which is perfect for us.Greg Proops voice is a little distracting, since I was an avid Whose Line fan, and it seems insane to hear Proops as Bob.  But younger viewers won't be affected!

reviewText: Bob the Builder's indomitable can-do attitude has inspired countless young viewers. "The Best of Bob the Builder" is a compilation of some of the best adventures of Bob and his machines, which serve as both his tools and his best friends. With bonus features of never before seen stories, and DVD games, "The Best of Bob the Builder" is a fine pick for any young viewer who can't get enough of Bob.
summary: A fine pick for any young viewer who can't get enough of Bob
Title: N/A

reviewText: My 22-month old grandson is captivated by Bob the Builder. At this point, he only focuses on the cute recurring characters, the talking construction vehicles, and the colorful and nicely animated stories. He never gets tired of watching it. (I'm the one who got this video because I'm practically able to recite the other one he has.)But, although it's beyond his current comprehension, these are stories of good people behaving responsibly and considerately. They are presented in an entertaining and non-preachy manner, and the color, audio, and animation are beautifully rendered and nicely paced.I should be jealous that my grandson learned to say "Bob" before "Grandma," but I'm so pleased with these videos that I don't mind.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Bob the Builder series is great for children. Bob is a solid citizen. We need more characters like him to balance the super heroes and fighting characters.
